src Package¶

src Package¶

generate_modules Module¶

sphinx-autopackage-script

This script parses a directory tree looking for python modules and packages and creates ReST files appropriately to create code documentation with Sphinx. It also creates a modules index (named modules.<suffix>).

src.generate_modules.create_module_file(package, module, opts)[source]¶

Build the text of the file and write the file.

src.generate_modules.create_modules_toc_file(master_package, modules, opts, name='modules')[source]¶

Create the module’s index.

src.generate_modules.create_package_file(root, master_package, subroot, py_files, opts, subs)[source]¶

Build the text of the file and write the file.

src.generate_modules.format_directive(module, package=None)[source]¶

Create the automodule directive and add the options.

src.generate_modules.format_heading(level, text)[source]¶

Create a heading of <level> [1, 2 or 3 supported].

src.generate_modules.is_excluded(root, excludes)[source]¶

Check if the directory is in the exclude list.

Note: by having trailing slashes, we avoid common prefix issues, like
e.g. an exlude “foo” also accidentally excluding “foobar”.
src.generate_modules.main()[source]¶

Parse and check the command line arguments.

src.generate_modules.makename(package, module)[source]¶

Join package and module with a dot.

src.generate_modules.normalize_excludes(rootpath, excludes)[source]¶

Normalize the excluded directory list: * must be either an absolute path or start with rootpath, * otherwise it is joined with rootpath * with trailing slash

src.generate_modules.recurse_tree(path, excludes, opts)[source]¶

Look for every file in the directory tree and create the corresponding ReST files.

src.generate_modules.shall_skip(module)[source]¶

Check if we want to skip this module.

src.generate_modules.write_file(name, text, opts)[source]¶

Write the output file for module/package <name>.

main Module¶

class src.main.FactoryThread(dir, update_function)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

__init__(dir, update_function)[source]¶

Calls super constructor and initializes class attributes

if self.deamon is set to True, the thread automatically becomes a ‘Deamon-Thread’ this basically means that if no other Threads are left, this Deamon Threads also automatically closes itself, which is incredibly helpful because the gui Thread gets terminated by closing the window but the factory_thread will always keep on running unless its a daemon thread

Parameters:
  • dir – directory with which the factory gets initialized
  • update_function –
run()[source]¶

gets called with .start()

initializes the factory, plays the playlist and starts the pyglet app

Returns:None
class src.main.gui(parent=None)[source]¶

Bases: PySide.QtGui.QWidget

__init__(parent=None)[source]¶

calls super constructor, initializes the gui and assigns class attributes also makes sure the button has the correct function assigned to it

Parameters:parent –
file_select()[source]¶

gets called when the button is pressed

disables the button and starts the factory process the factory process takes the dir (which gets returned by the QFileDialog) and the function to update the data

Returns:None
set_data(interpret, title, album)[source]¶

Updates the data on the gui

Parameters:
  • interpret – the intepret of the current song
  • title – title of the current song
  • album – album of the current song
Returns:

None
